intro: Compsoa hirta, commonly known as hairy compsoa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces showy yellow flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded areas. Its botanical features make it a notable species in botanical gardens and ecological studies.
